db:abstract.db:para: The QLayoutItem class provides an abstract item that a QLayout manipulates.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This is used by custom layouts.
Pure virtual functions are provided to return information about the layout, including, sizeHint(), minimumSize(), maximumSize() and expanding().
The layout's geometry can be set and retrieved with setGeometry() and geometry(), and its alignment with setAlignment() and alignment().
isEmpty() returns whether the layout item is empty. If the concrete item is a QWidget, it can be retrieved using widget(). Similarly for layout() and spacerItem().

Some layouts have width and height interdependencies. These can be expressed using hasHeightForWidth(), heightForWidth(), and minimumHeightForWidth(). For more explanation see the Qt Quarterly article Trading Height for Width.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QLayoutItem::QLayoutItem(Qt::Alignment alignment = 0)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a layout item with an alignment. Not all subclasses support alignment.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QLayoutItem::~QLayoutItem()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QLayoutItem.

db:section.db:title: Qt::Alignment QLayoutItem::alignment() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the alignment of this item.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QSizePolicy::ControlTypes QLayoutItem::controlTypes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the control type(s) for the layout item. For a QWidgetItem, the control type comes from the widget's size policy; for a QLayoutItem, the control types is derived from the layout's contents.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] Qt::Orientations QLayoutItem::expandingDirections() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this layout item can make use of more space than sizeHint(). A value of Qt::Vertical or Qt::Horizontal means that it wants to grow in only one dimension, whereas Qt::Vertical | Qt::Horizontal means that it wants to grow in both dimensions.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QRect QLayoutItem::geometry() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the rectangle covered by this layout item.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] bool QLayoutItem::hasHeightForWidth() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this layout's preferred height depends on its width; otherwise returns false. The default implementation returns false.
Reimplement this function in layout managers that support height for width.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] int QLayoutItem::heightForWidth(int) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the preferred height for this layout item, given the width w.

The default implementation returns -1, indicating that the preferred height is independent of the width of the item. Using the function hasHeightForWidth() will typically be much faster than calling this function and testing for -1.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] void QLayoutItem::invalidate()
db:section.db:para: Invalidates any cached information in this layout item.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] bool QLayoutItem::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Implemented in subclasses to return whether this item is empty, i.e. whether it contains any widgets.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QLayout *QLayoutItem::layout()
db:section.db:para: If this item is a QLayout, it is returned as a QLayout; otherwise 0 is returned. This function provides type-safe casting.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QSize QLayoutItem::maximumSize() const
db:section.db:para: Implemented in subclasses to return the maximum size of this item.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] int QLayoutItem::minimumHeightForWidth(int w) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the minimum height this widget needs for the given width, w. The default implementation simply returns heightForWidth(w).

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QSize QLayoutItem::minimumSize() const
db:section.db:para: Implemented in subclasses to return the minimum size of this item.

db:section.db:title: void QLayoutItem::setAlignment(Qt::Alignment alignment)
db:section.db:para: Sets the alignment of this item to alignment.

Note: Item alignment is only supported by QLayoutItem subclasses where it would have a visual effect. Except for QSpacerItem, which provides blank space for layouts, all public Qt classes that inherit QLayoutItem support item alignment.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] void QLayoutItem::setGeometry(const QRect &r)
db:section.db:para: Implemented in subclasses to set this item's geometry to r.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QSize QLayoutItem::sizeHint() const
db:section.db:para: Implemented in subclasses to return the preferred size of this item.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QSpacerItem *QLayoutItem::spacerItem()
db:section.db:para: If this item is a QSpacerItem, it is returned as a QSpacerItem; otherwise 0 is returned. This function provides type-safe casting.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QWidget *QLayoutItem::widget()
db:section.db:para: If this item is a QWidget, it is returned as a QWidget; otherwise 0 is returned. This function provides type-safe casting.
